front.title: A Container Type for the Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP)

abstract.t: The Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP), defined in RFC 2284, provides for support of multiple authentication methods. While EAP was originally created for use with PPP, it has since been adopted for use with IEEE 802.1X 'Network Port Authentication'. Since its deployment, a number of weaknesses in EAP have become apparent. These include the lack of protection for, and acknowledgement of Success and Failure messages.
